model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Okay I made a playlist for our meetup this weekend. It's all punk music, but I have an hour of fun music for the pool and more steady music for our programming studies. It's going to be fun!
That sounds great to me.  Hope I'm able to learn to swim. 
I can teach you! I have taught quite a few people so I'll help you 
I would really appreciate that. Maybe I could go on one of your next cruises.
Yeah, that would be great. I'm excited about going to the Carribean. I've never been. Have you?
No, I have not.  I've not been outside the US, but would love to go .Let me know how you like it.
I will! Is there a city you like to visit nearby while cruising in your car?
Yes, there are several. Hope we could meet and You possibly teach me about computer programming.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Learning to Swim and Programming', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A offers to teach Speaker B swimming and programming, incorporating punk music and pizzaburgers.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: So maybe you overthought and someday you will learn how to swim? ### Speaker B: Maybe you could teach me. Have you ever been to the carribean before? ### Speaker A: I could teach you! and the Carribean is my next trip. It might help if we put on some punk music before we get in the pool. ### Speaker B: Before during and after! I won't debate you on that. How are you liking this new job? I've always wanted to learn programming. ### Speaker A: It is a bit tedious and repetitive, but rewarding when the job is complete. Swimming helps me relax because it is a bit stressful at times. ### Speaker B: I can imagine. I eat pizzaburgers when Im stressed and I'm stressed a lot. Thats Why I'm thinking I cou;ld learn how to swim now. I'm pretty buoyant if you know what I mean ### Speaker A: haha. Bouyant is a good thing. It will help you float on your back. How about I teach you programming too? For ever hour in water, and hour of training for progrramming? ### Speaker B: And punk music!!! I've always wanteed to eat a pizza burger in a pool\ ### Speaker A: Pizzaburgers, Punk music Programming and some swim time! Its a deal.' }
```
